summary: Fix skills progress bar flicker by removing the 300ms timeout delay and ensuring proper initial state before CSS transitions. The issue stems from progress bars not having a defined initial width (0%) before the animation begins, causing visual glitches when the CSS transition starts.

action_plan.description: Modify animateSkillBar function to set initial width to 0% immediately before applying the target width
Remove the 300ms setTimeout delay that causes the flicker and backward movement
Add CSS rule to ensure skill-progress elements start with width: 0% by default
Test the animation by scrolling to skills section and verifying smooth progress bar animations
Verify animations work correctly across different browsers and screen sizes

risks: Animation timing might need fine-tuning if removing the timeout affects other visual elements
CSS specificity issues if the new width: 0% rule conflicts with existing styles
Potential performance impact if multiple skill bars animate simultaneously without the staggered delay
issue_title: Bug: Skills progress bars flicker and move backwards during animation
